021
022import java.time.ZoneId;
023import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
024import java.time.temporal.TemporalAccessor;
025import java.util.Locale;
026
027public interface DateTimeFormatterInterface {
028
029    /**
030     * Property tag for the date format that is to be used for the web
031     * application. "tool.dateTool.format"
032     */
033    final String DATE_TIME_FORMAT_KEY = "datetime.format";
034    
035    final String DATE_TIME_ZONEID_KEY = "datetime.zoneId";
036    
037    final String USE_TURBINE_LOCALE_KEY = "datetime.use.turbine.locale";
038    
039    final String USE_REQUEST_LOCALE_KEY = "tool.use.request.locale";
040    
041    /** Default date format. find supported formats in {@link DateTimeFormatterService} */
042    final String DATE_TIME_FORMAT_DEFAULT = "MM/dd/yyyy";
043
044    DateTimeFormatter getDefaultFormat();
045
046    String getFormatPattern();
047
048    /**
049     * Formats the given datetime as a String with the #{@link DateTimeFormatterService#getDefaultFormat()}.
050     * using the default date format.
051     *
052     * @param temporalAccessor {@link TemporalAccessor to format
053     * @return String value of the date
054     */
055    <T extends TemporalAccessor> String format(T temporalAccessor);
056
057    /**
058     * Formats the given date as a String.
059     *
060     * @param temporalAccessor TimeDate date to format
061     * @param dateFormatString format string to use.  See {@link DateTimeFormatter}
062     * for details.
063     * @return String value of the date
064     */
065    <T extends TemporalAccessor> String format(T temporalAccessor, String dateFormatString);
066
067    /**
068     * Formats the given date as a String.
069     *
070     * @param temporalAccessor TimeDate date to format
071     * @param dateFormatString format string to use.  See {@link DateTimeFormatter}
072     * for details.
073     * @param locale used to loclize the format
074     * @return String value of the date
075     */
076    <T extends TemporalAccessor> String format(T temporalAccessor, String dateFormatString, Locale locale);
077    
078    /**
079     * Formats the given date as a String.
080     *
081     * @param temporalAccessor TimeDate date to format
082     * @param dateFormatString format string to use.  See {@link DateTimeFormatter}
083     * for details.
084     * @param locale the {@link Locale}
085     * @param zoneId the {@link ZoneId}
086     * @return String value of the date
087     */
088    <T extends TemporalAccessor> String format(T temporalAccessor, String dateFormatString, Locale locale, ZoneId zoneId);
089
090    /**
091     * Maps from an incoming format to an outgoing format {@link DateTimeFormatter}.
092     * @param src the formatted datetime
093     * @param outgoingFormat the outgoingFormat pattern, {@link DateTimeFormatter}
094     * @param locale  Locale, if needed for outgoing formatting, no default.
095     * @param incomingFormat the incming format pattern {@link DateTimeFormatter}, optional, default is {@link #getDefaultFormat()}.
096     * @return the newly mapped
097     */
098    String map(String src, String outgoingFormat, Locale locale, String incomingFormat);
099
100    /**
101     * Uses as incoming format {@link #getDefaultFormat()} and no locale.
102     * @param src the text, which will be parsed using the incomingFormat.
103     * @param outgoingFormat the outgoing formatter, which will format.
104     * @param locale The locale, if not null which will outgoingFormat use, {@link DateTimeFormatter#withLocale(Locale)}.
105     * @param incomingFormat the incoming formatter, which will be parsed.
106     * @return the formatted string
107     *
108     */
109    String map(String src, DateTimeFormatter outgoingFormat, Locale locale,
110               DateTimeFormatter incomingFormat);
111
112    /**
113     * Uses as outgoing {@link DateTimeFormatter} {@link #getDefaultFormat()} and no locale.
114     *
115     * @param src the datetime formatted string
116     * @param outgoingFormat the format of this string
117     * @return the date time formatted
118     */
119    String mapTo(String src, DateTimeFormatter outgoingFormat);
120
121    /**
122     * @param src the datetime formatted string
123     * @param incomingFormat the format to which this incoming string should be formatted.
124     *
125     * @return the newly formatted date time string
126     */
127    String mapFrom(String src, DateTimeFormatter incomingFormat);
128
129    /**
130     * Uses as incoming {@link DateTimeFormatter}  {@link #getDefaultFormat()}.
131     *
132     * @param src the datetime formatted string
133     * @param outgoingFormat the format to which this string should be formatted.
134     * @param locale The locale, if not null,the incomingFormat will use.
135     *
136     * @return the newly formatted date time string
137     */
138    String map(String src, DateTimeFormatter outgoingFormat, Locale locale);
139
140    ZoneId getZoneId();
141}
